revisions.rev:
{{Infobox television season | season_name = That's So Raven (season 1) | bgcolour = #FF8C55 | image = | caption = | show_name = ''[[That's So Raven]]'' | dvd_release_date= | dvd_format = | country = [[United States]] | network = [[Disney Channel]] | first_aired = {{Start date|2003|01|17}} | last_aired = {{Start date|2003|09|12}}{{#tag:ref|Disney Channel left 3 season 1 episodes unaired until season 2 began.}} | num_episodes = 21 | prev_season = | next_season = [[That's So Raven (season 2)|Season 2]] }} The first season of '''''[[That's So Raven]]''''' aired on [[Disney Channel]] from January 17, 2003 to September 12, 2003. The season introduces the Baxter family, [[Raven Baxter|Raven]] ([[Raven-SymonÃ©]]), [[Cory Baxter|Cory]] ([[Kyle Massey]]), [[Tanya Baxter]] ([[T'Keyah Crystal KeymÃ¡h]]) and [[Victor Baxter]] ([[Rondell Sheridan]]) as they manage with Raven and her ability to see into the future. [[Orlando Brown]] and [[Anneliese van der Pol]] co-stars as Raven's best friends, Eddie Thomas and Chelsea Daniels. Guest stars for this season included: [[Kirsten Storms]], [[Brenda Song]], [[Mike Erwin]], [[Steven Anthony Lawrence]], [[Niecy Nash]] and [[Jenifer Lewis]]. ==Production== The original name for the main character was Dawn Baxter, and the show was originally named 'The Future Is on Me'. However, they changed the main character's name to Rose Baxter, and the show was called 'Absolutely Psychic'. Eventually, the show was finally called 'That's So Raven.'[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0300865/trivia That's So Raven Trivia] In a 2007 interview, Anneliese van der Pol stated that Chelsea's original name was Emma. Also, that the roles of Raven and Chelsea were switched, so that Chelsea was the psychic. The series filmed it's pilot episode in July 2001 and was picked up in August. This season was filmed November 2001-Summer 2002 and aired in [[Disney Channel UK]] in September 2002.The show then premiered on [[Disney Channel]] January 17, 2003. *'''Note''': If you look closely to the end credits of the first season they are copywriten for 2002 the planned year for its debut. The show is set in [[San Francisco]], with Raven going to Bayside High School, the name of the high school was also the main setting of the fellow [[teen sitcom]] ''[[Saved by the Bell]]''. ==Premise== The show is set in San Francisco and revolves around a teenager named Raven Baxter, played by Raven-SymonÃ©, and how she gets herself, her friends Eddie and Chelsea, and her family members, such as her brother Cory, out of various situations, usually by using her psychic powers and a variety of disguises. '''Tagline''': She can see the future. But she can't quite see what's coming next. ==Episodes== {{main|List of That's So Raven episodes}} {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! style="background:#ff8c55; color:#000;"| Series # ! style="background:#ff8c55; color:#000;"| Season # ! style="background:#ff8c55; color:#000;"| Title ! style="background:#ff8c55; color:#000;"| Directed by ! style="background:#ff8c55; color:#000;"| Written by ! style="background:#ff8c55; color:#000;"| Original air date ! style="background:#ff8c55; color:#000;"| Prod.
code ! style="background:#ff8c55; color:#000;"| U.S. viewers
(millions) {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=1 |EpisodeNumber2=1 |Title=Test of Friendship |DirectedBy=[[Rich Correll]] |WrittenBy=Bob Keyes & Doug Keyes |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|1|17}} |ProdCode=107 |Aux4=3.49[http://www.laughingplace.com/news-id107250.asp State of the Disney Channel Dec 2 2004] |ShortSummary=After Raven has a vision of Eddie failing a Spanish [[exam]], she tries her best to keep it from happening. When Eddie finds out that Raven knows the answers there is a true [[exam]] of friendship. '''Absent''': [[Rondell Sheridan]] as Victor Baxter and [[T'Keyah Crystal KeymÃ¡h]] as Tanya Baxter |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=2 |EpisodeNumber2=2 |Title=Mother Dearest |DirectedBy=[[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] |WrittenBy=Bob Keyes & Doug Keyes |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|1|17}} |ProdCode=102 |Aux4=3.56[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-97730302.html 'Raven' ratings take wing for Disney 1x02] |ShortSummary=Raven gets in trouble after she mouths off to a spiteful teacher. But when her parents reward her responsibility by buying her a new phone, she is quick to think of a way to skirt around the problem. Instead, she dresses up as her mother, Tanya Baxter, cooking up all sorts of chaos. '''First appearances''': Rondell Sheridan as Victor Baxter and T'Keyah Crystal KeymÃ¡h as Tanya Baxter '''Absent''': [[Anneliese van der Pol]] as Chelsea Daniels |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=3 |EpisodeNumber2=3 |Title=Party Animal |DirectedBy=Rich Correll |WrittenBy=[[Dava Savel]] |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|1|17}} |ProdCode=109 |Aux4=3.33[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-97730302.html 'Raven' ratings take wing for Disney 1x03] |ShortSummary=Raven and her brother Cory fight and t[[ease]] each other regularly. But when Raven has a vision of her brother getting mad at her, she attempts to reconcile by throwing him an animal themed birthday party. However, circumstances make the day much harder for Raven, who has to save her relationship with Cory...as well as her ambitious birthday [[plans]]. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=4 |EpisodeNumber2=4 |Title=Wake Up Victor |DirectedBy=Ken Ceizler |WrittenBy=Edward C. Evans & Susan Sherman |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|1|17}} |ProdCode=119 |Aux4=3.35[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-97730302.html 'Raven' ratings take wing for Disney 1x04] |ShortSummary=Cory and his friend Miles attempt to hypnotize Chelsea and Raven. Instead, they hyptonize Victor. However, Victor was supposed to appear on a prestigious cooking show with impatient host Kelly Bryant. Can Raven and her family save her dad from utter failure before it's too late? |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=5 |EpisodeNumber2=5 |Title=A Fish Called Raven |DirectedBy=[[Fred Savage]] |WrittenBy=Carla Banks Waddles |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|1|24}} |ProdCode=121 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=Raven's visions get the better of her when a malicious student [[report]]er, Serena, [[plan]]s to expose her secret to the whole of her school. Now, it is up to Raven to sabotage Eddie's big basketball game and keep her [[reputation]] intact. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=6 |EpisodeNumber2=6 |Title=Smell of Victory |DirectedBy=Lee Shallat-Chemel |WrittenBy=Laura Perkins-Brittain |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|1|31}} |ProdCode=101 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=Raven has been paired with Ben "Stinky" S[[turkey]] for a science [[project]]. However, his unbearable body odor poses a big difficulty when it comes to completing their [[DNA]] model. Meanwhile, Eddie tries to charm a girl at his school, which proves hard when he wakes up with a massive [[zit]] on his chin. '''Absent''': Anneliese van der Pol as Chelsea Daniels '''Note''': This episode was filmed in July 2001.
The Pilot episode of the series. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=7 |EpisodeNumber2=7 |Title=Campaign in the Neck |DirectedBy=[[Sean McNamara (director)|Sean McNamara]] |WrittenBy=Beth Seriff & Geoff Tarson |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|2|7}} |ProdCode=114 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=Raven has a vision that her best friend Chelsea (who is running to be Student President) loses in a landslide vote. To prevent her vision from coming true, she en[[list]]s Eddie and Cory to help with her [[Political campaign|campaign]]...completing student's chores in return for a vote for Chelsea. However, as Raven soon discover, things may not be as easy as they seem. '''Absent''': Rondell Sheridan as Victor Baxter |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=8 |EpisodeNumber2=8 |Title=Saving Psychic Raven |DirectedBy=Sean McNamara |WrittenBy=Jeff Abugov & [[Michael Feldman (writer)|Michael Feldman]] |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|2|21}} |ProdCode=120 |Aux4=2.50[http://www.broadcastingcable.com/article/148177-Cure_for_Cartoon_Network_More_Cartoons_.php Cure for Cartoon Network? More Cartoons!] |ShortSummary=After Raven loses a volleyball game for Bayside due to a vision she had on the court, she begins to find solace in a group of fellow Teen Psychics. Nevertheless, Eddie and Chelsea soon feel abandoned and it is up to Raven to choose which group of friends she will stick with. Meanwhile, Cory tries to find Lionel a mate. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=9 |EpisodeNumber2=9 |Title=The Parties |DirectedBy=Rich Correll |WrittenBy=Jeff Abugov & Michael Feldman |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|2|28}} |ProdCode=116 |Aux4=2.36[http://login.vnuemedia.com/hr/google/login_subscribe.jsp?id=2yhGvwhFqFOuSWgH4dp1cRSAfk85Lz2UbyX0MyRpuEcp5MQ4I0LnBRDiekYoKwcrltmnFAug9Mdu%0AvyEC57sdx7SVTG4R4OVHDGIiKsQ3Xs5x3hqbax0rXeeNXSj%2BvEEW%2FuzJhsfZ5AfSncxJoy7SNJKV%0AK5P6wKCA12Cr0Yvi61lwiLtxPx30Wsy2UfRvCYcJO4QyUASAbRIp5MQ4I0LnBcJEopNUva%2BWbq%2FG%0A8qGJjIs%3D Hollywood Reporter: Turner touts cable's gains] |ShortSummary=Raven is extremely excited when she is hosting her first proper party. But when Raven's arch enemy, Nicki ([[Kirsten Storm]]), sabotages her plans and embarrasses Raven in front of her entire school, Rae, Chelsea and Eddie take revenge. However, Raven starts feeling guilty, so she doesn't send the video of Nicki looking like a disaster to Nicki's party. In the end, Raven still gets revenge with [[poison ivy]] covered flowers. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=10 |EpisodeNumber2=10 |Title=Ye Olde Dating Game |DirectedBy=[[Matthew Diamond]] |WrittenBy=Michael Feldman |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|3|28}} |ProdCode=113 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=After Raven's vision reveals her crush Gabriel saying he likes her, she makes sure he is her date to the Renaissance Ball, even though Raven is already going with Ben S[[turkey]]. '''Absents''': Rondell Sheridan as Victor Baxter and T'Keyah Crystal KeymÃ¡h as Tanya Baxter |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=11 |EpisodeNumber2=11 |Title=Dissin' Cousins |DirectedBy=Rich Correll |WrittenBy=Susan Sherman |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|4|10}} |ProdCode=108 |Aux4=2.28[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-100392557.html Shaking Up the Magic Kingdom] |ShortSummary=Raven's rich and boastful cousin Andrea comes to visit, leading to a major tiff between the two girls. However, with Chelsea and Eddie's help, the two soon begin to reconcile, and Eddie's dream comes true. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=12 |EpisodeNumber2=12 |Title=Teach Your Children Well |DirectedBy=[[Tony Singletary]] |WrittenBy=Beth Seriff & Geoff Tarson |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|5|2}} |ProdCode=111 |Aux4=2.12[http://www.broadcastingcable.com/article/151007-TNT_Disney_Tops_in_Basic_Cable_s_3Q.php Disney Tops in Basic Cable] |ShortSummary=Raven is furious (and embarrassed) when her Mom accepts a job teaching English at her school. But when a ruthless note finds its way into Tanya's grasp, it is up to Raven, Eddie and Chelsea to save the note before Raven gets in trouble. '''Absent''': Rondell Sheridan as Victor Baxter |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=13 |EpisodeNumber2=13 |Title=Driven to Insanity |DirectedBy=Matthew Diamond |WrittenBy=Dava Savel |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|5|30}} |ProdCode=104 |Aux4=2.65[http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=AK&s_site=ohio&p_multi=AK&p_theme=realcities&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=0FB9150547DDDA0E&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM Beacon Journal: Even Stevens, Lizzie McGuire, That's So Raven] |ShortSummary=Raven goes out with an older boy, against her parents' wishes. As always, the night turns into a disaster when Raven's date turns out to be a disgusting and rude slob, and her parents' turn up at the restaurant. Meanwhile, Cory is doing everything in his power to spend some time with Chelsea. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=14 |EpisodeNumber2=14 |Title=A Dog By Any Other Name |DirectedBy=[[Gerren Keith]] |WrittenBy=[[Michael Poryes]] & Susan Sherman |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|6|20}} |ProdCode=103 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=Chelsea likes a boy called Sam ([[Mike Erwin]]), but soon discovers that her relationship won't be as easy as it seems...the boy has the same name as her dog. '''Absent''': T'Keyah Crystal KeymÃ¡h as Tanya Baxter |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=15 |EpisodeNumber2=15 |Title=Saturday Afternoon Fever |DirectedBy=Matthew Diamond |WrittenBy=Chip Keyes |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|7|11}} |ProdCode=106 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=Raven is assigned to spend '[[quality]] time' with her mother at the movies, even though she is also going on a date to the movies with heartthrob Emett. So Raven tries to juggle both tasks... with disastrous [[results]]. '''Absent''': Anneliese van der Pol as Chelsea Daniels |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=16 |EpisodeNumber2=16 |Title=A Fight at the Opera |DirectedBy=[[David Kendall (director)|David Kendall]] |WrittenBy=Beth Seriff & Geoff Tarson |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|8|8}} |ProdCode=118 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=Raven and Chelsea are both appearing in their school's Classical Art's Festival. However, they dispute over creative differences. Raven wants to do an opera on [[credit card]]s while Chelsea is leaning towards problems with [[acid]] rain. The two split up and it is now up to MC Eddie to reconcile the life long friends. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=17 |EpisodeNumber2=17 |Title=Psychics Wanted |DirectedBy=Sean McNamara |WrittenBy=Maria Espada |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|8|22}} |ProdCode=117 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=Raven becomes infatuated with a jazz musician called Quiz. To earn money to buy Jazz Festival [[tickets]], she becomes a psychic for a phone line called Psychic Sidekicks. But she soon abuses her power by making Quiz like her. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=18 |EpisodeNumber2=18 |Title=If I Only Had a Job |DirectedBy=Rich Correll |WrittenBy=Laura Perkins-Brittain & Carla Banks Waddles |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|9|12}} |ProdCode=110 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=After having a vision that her dad was going to get fired, Raven attempts to rescue her dad's place, but instead, gets him fired. Now, it is up to her, Chelsea and Eddie to 'bring Victor back'. But, as always, disguise is needed. '''Absent''': T'Keyah Crystal KeymÃ¡h as Tanya Baxter |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=19 |EpisodeNumber2=19 |Title=Escape Claus |DirectedBy=Matthew Diamond |WrittenBy=Carla Banks Waddles |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|12|5}} |ProdCode=105 |Aux4=4.74[http://www.cbspressexpress.com/div.php/cbs_network/release?id=6274 ''Raven'' Christmas episode ranks number one in tweens] |ShortSummary=In this special [[Christmas]] episode, Raven opens her beautiful Christmas present early, but after wearing it at school, she breaks it. She must sacrifice all her favorite Christmas traditions to mend the trouble she caused, even if it means skipping school. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=20 |EpisodeNumber2=20 |Title=Separation Anxiety |DirectedBy=Rich Correll |WrittenBy=Michael Poryes & Susan Sherman |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2003|12|19}} |ProdCode=115 |Aux4=N/A |ShortSummary=Raven is terrified when she has a vision that her parents will split up. To prevent it from happening, she reconstructs their first date at Rusty's Bar and Grill, a country western [[restaurant]]. '''Note''': This is the last episode of season 1 that Rondell Sheridan and T'Keyah Crystal KeymÃ¡h are present in. |LineColor=FF8C55 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of That's So Raven episodes |EpisodeNumber=21 |EpisodeNumber2=21 |Title=To See Or Not To See |DirectedBy=Rich Correll |WrittenBy=Carla Banks Waddles |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2004|3|5}} |ProdCode=112 |Aux4=4.36[http://www.cbspressexpress.com/div.php/cbs_network/release?id=6052 ''Raven'' finale viewing figures number one for Disney Channel] |ShortSummary= Raven's visions cause embarrassing moments for both Eddie and Chelsea. She is miserable about her visions and being different from others. Instead, she finds solace in her Grandma Viv, who has a secret to tell her. '''Absent''': Rondell Sheridan as Victor Baxter and T'Keyah Crystal KeymÃ¡h as Tanya Baxter |LineColor=FF8C55 }} |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.tv.com/thats-so-raven/show/8257/episode.html?tag=list_header;paginator;1&season=1 List of ''That's So Raven'' (season 1) episodes] at [[TV.com]] {{That's So Raven}} {{DEFAULTSORT:That's So Raven}} [[Category:2003 television seasons]] [[Category:Lists of children's television series episodes]] [[Category:Lists of sitcom television series episodes]] [[Category:Lists of Disney Channel shows' episodes]] [[Category:That's So Raven]]
